title: Tesla plans $20 billion capital spending spree in push beyond human-driven cars
summary: Tesla plans to significantly increase its capital spending to over $20 billion this year, primarily focusing on ventures beyond traditional electric vehicles for human drivers. This investment targets autonomous vehicles like the Cybercab, humanoid robots, and battery/lithium production, reflecting a strategic shift towards AI-driven technologies. CEO Elon Musk emphasized this is a "very big capex year" for an "epic future," moving away from car production in some factories to prioritize these new business lines, which aim to justify the company's valuation akin to major tech firms rather than automotive manufacturers.

title: Meta Guidance Lifts Shares 9%; Microsoft Drops 7%, Tesla Edges Up 2%
summary: Meta Platforms' shares surged 9% in aftermarket trading after the company issued a bullish first-quarter sales forecast that significantly beat analyst expectations. In contrast, Microsoft's stock dropped 7% due to slowing cloud growth and higher-than-expected capital expenditures, raising concerns about its AI investment returns. Tesla also saw a modest 2% gain after beating Q4 earnings expectations, despite reporting its first-ever annual revenue decline.

title: Tesla profit falls again as sales and revenue decline, expenses pile up
summary: Tesla's profit experienced a significant decline in the fourth quarter of 2025, with net income falling 61% and annual profit dropping 46%, marking the second consecutive year of decline. Despite the financial headwinds, CEO Elon Musk expressed optimism about the company's self-driving projects, including robotaxis and the Cybercab, and the development of the Optimus robot. The company is re-focusing on Full Self-Driving subscriptions while facing challenges like waning EV interest and increased competition.

title: Amazing Abundance: Tesla's robot-fueled vision for the future (TSLA:NASDAQ)
summary: Tesla is shifting its focus towards robotics, embodied by its "Amazing Abundance" mission and Optimus robots. This strategic pivot involves ending production of Model S and Model Y to reallocate resources to autonomy and advanced robotics, aiming to reshape economic output. Key risks include battery supply constraints and potential margin compression in the energy sector.

title: Musk Says Tesla Needs to Build ‘TeraFab’ to Manufacture Chips
summary: Elon Musk announced that Tesla plans to build a "TeraFab" for manufacturing semiconductors, a move he says is necessary to avert a probable constraint in chip supply within three to four years. This large-scale facility will incorporate logic, memory, and packaging capabilities and signifies a significant expansion for Tesla beyond its traditional electric vehicle manufacturing. The project is expected to cost billions of dollars and will operate domestically.

title: Tesla to Invest $2 Billion in Elon Musk’s xAI, Cancel Two EV Models
summary: Tesla announced a 61% drop in Q4 profit and plans to invest $2 billion in xAI, Elon Musk's private artificial intelligence firm. This investment follows a mixed reception from shareholders who previously voted against a similar proposal. The company also indicated it would convert part of its Fremont factory to produce Optimus robots, while canceling two EV models.

title: Earnings live: IBM stock surges, Whirlpool slides; Meta, Microsoft, Tesla report beats across the board
summary: The fourth-quarter earnings season saw strong performances from tech giants like Meta, Microsoft, and Tesla, with Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg highlighting a major AI acceleration. IBM stock surged due to accelerated software revenue growth, while Whirlpool missed expectations due to tariffs and an intense promotional environment. Several other companies, including ServiceNow, GE Vernova, and Texas Instruments, also reported their latest earnings, reflecting varied impacts from market conditions and AI demand.

title: STERIS plc announces $0.63 quarterly dividend payable in March
summary: STERIS plc announced a quarterly dividend of $0.63 per share, payable on March 19, 2026, continuing its 21-year streak of dividend payments. The company, which specializes in infection prevention solutions, boasts a "GREAT" financial health score from InvestingPro and an annual yield of 0.96%. This dividend announcement follows the company's Q2 fiscal year 2025 earnings report where it surpassed EPS expectations but missed revenue projections.

title: Tesla revenue beats estimates despite delivering fewer vehicles than expected
summary: Tesla reported that its revenue for the final three months of the previous year exceeded analyst estimates, reaching US$24.9-billion, and adjusted earnings per share were 50 cents, surpassing targets of 45 cents. The company announced a US$2-billion investment in Elon Musk's AI company xAI and affirmed that production of its Cybercab robotaxi and Semi trucks is on schedule for this year. Despite its vehicle business facing pressure, Tesla's automotive gross margin and energy storage business showed strong performance, with the energy unit's deployments rising by 29%.

title: Tesla Posts Fourth-Quarter Profit That Beats Expectations
summary: Tesla Inc. announced plans to invest $2 billion into Elon Musk's AI company, xAI, which they believe will enhance Tesla's ability to develop and deploy AI products and services. This announcement came alongside their report of higher-than-expected profit for the fourth quarter. The company stated this investment aims to expand its AI capabilities into the physical world at scale.

title: Tesla earnings come with a massive spending forecast as Musk moves further beyond cars
summary: Tesla reported its fourth-quarter earnings, revealing plans to discontinue the Model S and X and significantly increase capital spending. Baird analyst Ben Kallo views Tesla's strategy to double its spending as a positive move to build out its "physical AI value chain" and commercialize new products like the Cybercab and Optimus robots, which are expected to drive revenue growth in the coming years.

title: Alumis stock hits all-time high at 27.28 USD
summary: Alumis Inc. (ALMS) stock reached an all-time high of $27.45, reflecting strong investor confidence and a 293.34% one-year return. The biotechnology company, with a market capitalization of $3.24 billion, recently raised $345.1 million through a public offering and saw increased price targets from analysts following positive Phase III trial results for its oral TYK2 inhibitor, Envudeucitinib.

title: Apple earnings: Wedbush’s Ives sees iPhone strength, AI strategy taking shape
summary: Wedbush analyst Dan Ives anticipates strong fiscal first-quarter results for Apple, driven by robust iPhone 17 sales and a rebound in the Chinese market. Ives also expects Apple to detail a more comprehensive AI strategy, particularly concerning Siri and its partnership with Google, which he believes the market currently undervalues. Wedbush maintains an Outperform rating and a $350 price target for Apple, viewing 2026 as a pivotal year for the company's AI ambitions.

title: Tesla Keeps Getting Fined in the UK for Refusing to Name Speeding Drivers
summary: Tesla is facing repeated fines in the UK for failing to identify drivers involved in traffic violations, accumulating at least 18 convictions and over $27,000 in penalties since early 2024. British law requires vehicle lease providers to name drivers for prosecution, a legal obligation Tesla Financial Services has struggled to meet, citing "technical issues." Some sources suggest Tesla might prioritize customer privacy over compliance, viewing the fines as a cost of doing business.

title: Tesla earnings are here, and stock jumps 3%
summary: Tesla reported its fourth-quarter earnings, disclosing a massive spending forecast of $20 billion, significantly up from $8.5 billion in 2025, and the discontinuation of its Model S and X vehicles. CEO Elon Musk attributed this substantial capital expenditure to addressing geopolitical risks and ensuring the company's ability to scale autonomous vehicles, robots, and AI chips. Despite an initial stock jump, shares lost some momentum during the earnings call as investors digested the large capex number.

title: Earnings Estimates Moving Higher for Ford Motor (F): Time to Buy?
summary: Ford Motor Company (F) is seeing its earnings estimates move higher, driven by growing analyst optimism. This positive trend in revisions has led to a Zacks Rank #1 (Strong Buy) for the stock, indicating potential for continued outperformance. Investors are encouraged to consider Ford due to its improving earnings outlook and recent stock gains.

title: Phunware launches new hospitality software products for luxury hotels
summary: Phunware Inc. (NASDAQ:PHUN) has launched two new hospitality-focused software products, Luxury Engagement and Enriched Experience, aimed at luxury hotels and resorts. Despite facing a 33% revenue decline, the company's interim CEO, Jeremy Krol, believes these new offerings will enhance guest experiences and improve hotel economics, citing over 70% guest app adoption rates. This strategic move follows recent board appointments and a revised price target from H.C. Wainwright.

title: Ainos Expands SmellTech Strategy with Trusval Agreement
summary: Ainos Inc. (NASDAQ: AIMD) has seen its stock rise by 22.12% following promising lab test results and a new strategic partnership. The company is advancing its SmellTech platform to digitize the sense of smell, aiming to revolutionize industries like semiconductor production and robotics through artificial intelligence and a collaboration with Trusval Technology. Despite current financial challenges, Ainos is focused on long-term market expansion and leveraging its innovative technology for significant gains.

title: General Motors Isn't Giving Up On EVs. But What About Hybrids?
summary: General Motors is not planning to significantly shift its strategy towards hybrids, despite their current popularity among other automakers. CEO Mary Barra stated that GM's market share growth in 2025, primarily driven by strong SUV and crossover sales, indicates they have the right product portfolio with a focus on EVs and ICE vehicles. While EV sales saw a dip in Q4 2025, the company asserts its commitment to its dedicated EV platform and strong ICE lineup, not seeing a current need for a broader hybrid offering.

title: Baird Medical concludes gynecological microwave ablation masterclass
summary: Baird Medical Investment Holdings Ltd. has completed a Gynecological Microwave Ablation Masterclass in Shanghai, aimed at training physicians in the use of its minimally invasive treatment technology. This educational initiative is part of the company's continuous efforts to expand the use of its FDA 510(k)-certified medical devices for benign gynecological conditions in clinics globally. The company also announced recent strategic developments including regulatory approvals in Pakistan and Vietnam, a US manufacturing partnership, new CEO for its US subsidiary, entry into the Egyptian market, and a strategic partnership with Stonewood Key Capital to enhance global operations.

title: Tesla’s European Sales Collapse as Stock Surges
summary: Tesla's sales in Europe experienced a significant collapse last year, dropping 27%, while competitor BYD saw a 267% increase in registrations. Despite faltering sales in both Europe and the United States, Tesla's stock has surged by 36% in the past six months, outperforming the broader market. This divergence is attributed less to current auto sales and more to investor bets on Tesla's future success in self-driving technology and their Optimus robots.

title: Sleep Number stock rises after Travis Kelce takes stake in mattress maker
summary: Sleep Number (NASDAQ:SNBR) stock rose 4% after NFL star Travis Kelce acquired a stake in the mattress maker as part of a new three-year partnership deal, making him one of their top shareholders. Kelce, who has endorsed Sleep Number since 2020, will be featured in national advertising campaigns and is purchasing shares directly while receiving additional restricted stock. This investment follows his previous stake in Six Flags Entertainment, which also saw a share increase upon the news.

title: 3 Stocks Under $10 with Warning Signs
summary: This article identifies three stocks priced under $10 (Blink Charging, PacBio, and Western Union) that carry significant warning signs, advising investors to exercise caution. The analysis highlights issues such as declining sales, cash burn, unfavorable liquidity, and negative earnings profiles. StockStory suggests avoiding these companies and instead considering higher-quality assets for better long-term returns.

title: Top 10: Largest Factories
summary: This article lists the top 10 largest factories globally by gross floor area, highlighting their significance in manufacturing, employment, and the global economy. It details the key products, companies, and impressive scales of operations for each factory, ranging from automotive plants like Volkswagen's Wolfsburg to high-tech semiconductor fabs by TSMC and Samsung, and battery production bases by CATL and BYD. The list underscores the crucial role these industrial giants play in shaping various sectors and driving economic growth.

title: Discipline and Rules-Based Execution in TSLT Response
summary: This article provides an analysis of T-rex 2x Long Tesla Daily Target Etf (NASDAQ: TSLT), highlighting positive near-term sentiment within a long-term strength context, despite a mid-term weak bias. It outlines three distinct trading strategies—Position Trading, Momentum Breakout, and Risk Hedging—generated by AI models, complete with entry zones, targets, and stop losses. The analysis also includes multi-timeframe signal analysis, indicating strong signals for both near-term and long-term horizons, but weak for mid-term.

title: A New Era in Options Trading! Futu Partners with Nasdaq to Deliver Monday & Wednesday Expirations for Greater Flexibility and Opportunity
summary: Futu Holdings Limited announced that its Futubull and Moomoo platforms will support Nasdaq's new Monday and Wednesday options expirations, making it one of the first brokers to offer this. This innovation, following SEC approval for nine high-profile securities including the "Magnificent Seven," increases trading frequency to three times a week, enhancing flexibility for short-term options trading and risk management. Futu provides advanced tools and strategies to help investors leverage these extended options expiration dates in a volatile market.

title: General Motors CEO Mary Barra says she still responds to 'every single letter' by hand despite running a $74,000,000,000 business
summary: Mary Barra, the CEO of General Motors, personally responds to every letter she receives from customers, both positive and negative, despite leading a multi-billion dollar company. She revealed this at a New York Times event in December, emphasizing her personal approach to the business. Barra, who started as a co-op student in 1980, has been CEO since 2014 and is also driving GM towards autonomous and electric car development.

title: Tesla Q4 EPS Preview: Sluggish Sales & New Frontiers
summary: Tesla is set to report Q4 earnings, with analysts expecting a significant year-over-year decline in EPS and projected revenue of approximately $24.75 billion. Despite sluggish EV sales due to factors like the end of federal tax credits and high interest rates, the article highlights that Tesla's stock has quadrupled since late 2023 lows, driven by investor focus on its diversifying segments beyond traditional EVs. Key drivers for future growth include Tesla Energy, the Robotaxi/FSD network, the upcoming Optimus humanoid robot, and the Semi truck, which are expected to offset current EV market headwinds.

title: Why Tesla earnings might not matter much
summary: Tesla's upcoming earnings report is expected to focus more on its AI ambitions, such as humanoid robots and robotaxis, rather than its declining EV sales. Despite a slump in vehicle deliveries and reduced revenue expectations, investors are keenly interested in CEO Elon Musk's future plans. Analysts suggest that the auto business will receive less attention compared to the company's long-range goals and potential competition for investor capital from a SpaceX IPO.

title: Can-Fite BioPharma schedules special shareholder meeting as NYSE American issues non-compliance notice
summary: Can-Fite BioPharma will hold a Special General Meeting of Shareholders on March 3, 2026, to address a non-compliance notice from the NYSE American. The notice stemmed from the company's audit committee not having enough independent members after a director's resignation. The meeting's agenda includes electing a new independent director to help the company regain compliance by July 2026 or January 2027.

title: Tesla Stock Falls. Why Its Earnings Will Be ‘Ugly.’
summary: Tesla stock experienced a decline on Tuesday ahead of its fourth-quarter earnings report, which analysts anticipate will be unfavorable. Despite expected "ugly" earnings, the article suggests it might not significantly impact the stock's performance. The stock has been relatively stagnant over the past year, showing a modest gain.

title: Silver Tops Tech Stocks as Retail Traders’ Top Bet, But Bearish Bets Are Rising Too
summary: Retail investors are heavily investing in silver, with the iShares Silver Trust (SLV) seeing a record single-day inflow of $171 million, surpassing tech stocks as the top retail trade. Silver prices have surged over 52% in 2026, also boosting mining stocks like Hecla Mining (HL) and Coeur Mining (CDE). However, there's growing bearish sentiment, as evidenced by significant inflows into ProShares UltraShort Silver (ZSL), with some market veterans skeptical of the rally's fundamental basis.

title: Move Over, Tesla Solar. These 2 Energy Stocks Are Powering The Future of AI
summary: The article discusses how the rising demand for electricity, driven by EVs, data centers, and AI, is leading to increased reliance on Virtual Power Plants (VPPs). National Grid and Sunrun are highlighted as key players benefiting from this trend through their VPP operations. These companies are generating additional revenue and profits by providing flexible and cost-effective alternatives to traditional power plants, addressing the immediate threat of blackouts, and building a more resilient infrastructure for future energy demands.

title: Lemonade, Inc. (NYSE:LMND) Receives Average Rating of "Hold" from Analysts
summary: Nine analysts have given Lemonade (NYSE:LMND) an average rating of "Hold," with a 12-month average target price of $71.50. Despite beating Q3 earnings estimates, the company remains unprofitable with a negative net margin and return on equity. Insiders have recently sold over 300,000 shares, though institutional investors still hold a significant portion of the stock.

title: Tesla lost $15 billion in brand value in 2025 as Musk stepped deeper into politics, research shows
summary: Tesla's brand value declined by 36% in 2025, a $15.4 billion loss, marking its third consecutive year of drops, according to Brand Finance. This decline is attributed to CEO Elon Musk's political involvement, a lack of new model innovation, and high EV prices compared to competitors. Despite this, Tesla's stock saw an 11% gain by the end of 2025 due to the launch of its ride-hailing app and Musk's stock purchases, while its sister company, Starlink, entered the top 500 brand rankings.

title: Tesla: Autonomy Stack Isn’t Ready To Justify Valuation (Rating Downgrade) (NASDAQ:TSLA)
summary: Tesla has been downgraded from "hold" to "sell" due to persistent overvaluation and slow progress on its ambitious autonomy and robotics goals. Despite the company's strategy relying on widespread deployment of its autonomy stack across various sectors, execution of FSD and Optimus lags significantly. Furthermore, a decline in automotive sales globally, particularly in China and Europe, is hindering the funding for these broader ambitions, while the company's valuation remains inflated.

title: Form 424B2 CANADIAN IMPERIAL BANK
summary: Canadian Imperial Bank of Commerce (CIBC) has filed a Form 424B2 for Market Linked Securities—Auto-Callable with Contingent Coupon with Memory Feature and Contingent Downside Principal at Risk Securities due January 26, 2029. These securities are linked to the performance of the common stock of General Motors Company, Micron Technology, Inc., and Tesla, Inc., with payments depending on the lowest performing stock. Investors face the risk of losing a significant portion or all of their principal if the securities are not automatically called and the lowest performing stock declines below its downside threshold.

title: Where Will Lucid Be in 1 Year?
summary: Lucid increased its EV production by 104% in 2025, reaching 18,378 vehicles, a significant achievement for a startup. However, this volume is still dwarfed by competitors like Rivian and Tesla, highlighting the need for much greater scale to achieve profitability. The company faces a challenging year ahead and is unlikely to reach sustainable profit in the next 12 months, despite management's efforts.

title: When Tesla reports earnings, this could be the biggest highlight
summary: As Tesla prepares to report its fourth-quarter earnings, analysts are eyeing its energy-storage and -generation business as a potential highlight, despite an expected decline in overall revenue due to softer EV sales. This segment has shown consistent growth and is anticipated to continue picking up the slack from the electric vehicle division. The company's AI plans are also noted as a contributing factor helping to offset challenges in car sales.

title: Not Owning Tesla (TSLA) Impacted NewBridge Large Cap Growth Equity’s Performance
summary: NewBridge Asset Management's Large Cap Growth Equity Strategy underperformed its benchmark in Q4 2025, largely due to its significant holding in Uber Technologies, Inc. balanced against not owning Tesla, Inc. The firm notes that Tesla's stock performance was boosted by factors like Elon Musk's alignment with Trump and potential benefits from the elimination of EV tax credits. Despite Tesla's strong quarterly gains, NewBridge suggests that some AI stocks offer greater upside potential with less downside risk.

title: Uber Technologies (UBER) was the Worst Performer: NewBridge Large Cap Growth Equity
summary: NewBridge Asset Management's Q4 2025 letter for its Large Cap Growth Equity Strategy revealed that Uber Technologies (UBER) was the portfolio's worst performer, declining nearly 19% during the quarter. This underperformance was contrasted with Tesla's significant gain, largely attributed to perceived competition in autonomous vehicles and the "Trump trade" favoring Tesla. Despite this, NewBridge remains confident in Uber's fundamentals due to its large network platform, believing the perceived advantages of competitors like Tesla will take years to materialize at scale.

title: Silver is retail traders' new obsession as record numbers bet on rally — and on a crash
summary: Retail investors are actively trading silver, with record inflows into the iShares Silver Trust (SLV) ETF, indicating a strong belief in its rally. Simultaneously, a significant number of individual investors are making leveraged bets on silver crashing, leading to what an analyst describes as a "two-front war." This heightened interest has made silver the new epicenter of retail trading fervor, even surpassing the trading momentum of popular tech stocks like Nvidia.

title: 3 Growth Funds That Take Stock Valuations Seriously
summary: This article highlights three growth funds—MFS Massachusetts Investors Growth Stock MIGFX, T. Rowe Price Growth Stock PRGFX, and Loomis Sayles Growth LGRRX—that prioritize valuation discipline even when investing in growth stocks. These funds aim to avoid overpaying for high-growth companies, often leading to different portfolio compositions compared to market indexes dominated by "Magnificent Seven" stocks. While some have experienced periods of underperformance due to this conservative approach, they have also demonstrated an ability to mitigate losses during market downturns.

title: Deere’s Strategic Pivot: Navigating Cyclical Headwinds with Technology
summary: Deere & Company is actively addressing a projected "trough year" in 2026 for its major equipment cycle by aggressively expanding its technological portfolio to create stable, high-margin revenue streams. Despite anticipated declines in its North American large agriculture equipment segment and increased labor costs, the company aims to offset these with growth in other divisions, price adjustments, and recurring income from precision technology subscriptions. This strategy is critical for balancing short-term cyclical pressures with long-term technological innovation for sustained profitability.

title: Will Trimble (TRMB) Beat Estimates Again in Its Next Earnings Report?
summary: Trimble Navigation (TRMB) is predicted to beat its upcoming earnings estimates, continuing a strong trend of exceeding expectations in its last two quarterly reports. The company's positive Zacks Earnings ESP of +1.91% combined with a Zacks Rank #2 (Buy) indicates a high probability of another positive surprise. Investors are advised to check a company's Earnings ESP before its release to increase the odds of success.

title: Genenta Science to Rebrand as Saentra Forge and Enters Defense Sector with A.T.C. Stake, While Suing Enea Tech Biomedical
summary: Genenta Science is set to rebrand as Saentra Forge and expand into the defense and aerospace sectors, acquiring an initial 19.5% stake in rifle maker A.T.C. with a path to majority control. Concurrently, the company has initiated legal proceedings against Fondazione Enea Tech Biomedical over an unfulfilled €20 million convertible bond agreement. This strategic repositioning aligns with Italy's Golden Power framework, seeking to build a scalable platform for industrial growth in national-security regulated industries.

title: Cullen Frost Bankers Inc. Has $28.33 Million Stock Position in Tesla, Inc. $TSLA
summary: Cullen Frost Bankers Inc. increased its stake in Tesla, Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) by 3.4% in the third quarter, bringing its total holdings to 63,700 shares valued at $28.33 million. Other hedge funds also adjusted their positions, with insider selling observed from directors James R. Murdoch and Kimbal Musk. Analyst ratings for TSLA are mixed, with a consensus "Hold" rating and an average price target of $410.77.

title: Retail Resiliency: Walmart and Home Depot Anchor Dow Gains Amidst Market Turbulence
summary: The article highlights how Walmart and Home Depot are acting as stabilizing forces for the Dow Jones Industrial Average amidst market turbulence, echoing a trend from early 2025 where retail giants buoyed the market against downturns in technology stocks. It discusses how these "defensive powerhouses" leverage scale, strategic acquisitions, and integrated physical/digital storefronts to maintain profitability and growth, even as other sectors and smaller retailers struggle with volatility, trade tariffs, and interest rate fluctuations. The piece anticipates a potential repeat of this retail rally in February 2026, with upcoming earnings reports from both companies serving as key indicators for the market.

title: EFG Asset Management North America Corp. Acquires New Stake in Oracle Corporation $ORCL
summary: EFG Asset Management North America Corp. has acquired a new stake in Oracle Corporation, purchasing 14,797 shares valued at approximately $4.16 million in the third quarter. Oracle is supported by strategic catalysts such as a finalized U.S. TikTok JV stake, expanded OpenAI data center plans, and a significant AI-driven revenue backlog. Analysts maintain a "Moderate Buy" consensus, though sentiment is mixed due to divergent price targets and recent insider selling.

title: VinFast teams with Autobrains on low-cost autonomy push
summary: Vietnamese EV manufacturer VinFast has partnered with AI company Autobrains to develop affordable self-driving technology that uses cameras instead of expensive sensor arrays. This "Robo-Car" approach will initially enhance VinFast's existing SAE Level 2 ADAS capabilities, with pilot testing already underway in Hanoi. The strategy aims to make AV features viable for mass-market EVs, despite the technical challenges posed by Hanoi's chaotic traffic conditions.
